Description: Papyrus. Demotic letter about the attempts to deal with a debt of deben after partial payment before a trustee. 4th- 3rd cent. BC; Upper Egypt. Broken at the top and lacunae on the left. x+17 lines of text on the recto; 16+x lines on the verso.
Curator's comments: Bibliography Martin, C.J. 2016-2017. The Michaelides Demotic Material, Enchoria 35: 1-8.
Published by E. Cruz-Uribe and C.F. Nims, 'Troubles with a Debt: An Egyptian Papyrus Document', JNES 49 (1990), 281-90.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (46247) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/46247)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragile Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape, kraft paper Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
